w: let them ever shout for joy
You made him a little lower
He is at my right hand
You have made known to me
and my cry for His help
You will put them to flight
to the roof of my mouth
and I give thanks to Him
is the strength of His people
and from those who pursue me
Then I will give You thanks
and He will raise you up
that I may again be cheered
You put those who hate us
sing to Him a psalm of praise
He has shown Himself to be
He will surely take me to Himself
and to him who rightly orders
Let death seize them by surprise
through the watches of the night
They will be made to stumble
it was like the snow falling
May those who hope in You
and those who lie in wait
I have kept my heart pure
to Him who is to be feared
matches the fear You are due
that we may sing for joy
When he calls out to Me
like that of a wild ox
let us make a joyful noise
and they will be passed on
And the LORD made His people
So they provoked [the LORD] to anger
and in the shadow of death
and the waves of the sea
they will be put to shame
He has made His light to shine
and I will give You thanks
and in them I find comfort
and You do what is good
to the roof of my mouth
before one of them came to be
be an act of loving devotion
they are too strong for me
or I will be like those
The LORD is faithful in all His words
and kind in all His actions
